required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Prognostic Significance of Premature Ventricular Complexes in Patients Without Structural Heart Disease
clinical_study.official_title: The Prognostic Significance of Premature Ventricular Complexes in Patients Without Structural Heart Disease

brief_summary.textblock: With this project the investigators aim to investigate whether premature ventricular complexes (PVC) have a prognostic significance in persons without structural heart disease. Further the investigators look at the possible connection between PVC-morphology and clinical outcome and investigate whether advanced cardiac imaging-methods may identify subtle signs of heart disease in PVC-patients with normal findings at echocardiography.

detailed_description.textblock:
The PULSE project consists of four different studies:
- in study one the investigators include patients who are evaluated because of PVCs and have no signs of structural heart disease at echocardiography and exercise test. The investigators follow them (average follow-up time 3,5 years) to investigate if they have a higher mortality och cardiovascular morbidity than standard population
- in study two the investigators carry out a sub-group analysis of the population in study one to assess whether PVC:s different sites of origin (morphology) are related to the clinical outcome
- in study three the investigators include persons with a high PVC-burden (at least 10 000 PVC:s/day) and normal echocardiography. The included subjects undergo magnetic resonance (MR) to investigate whether it can identify signs of heart disease where standard echocardiography cannot

primary_outcome.description: Mortality compared with sex and age-matched control population. Data for Control population obtained via Socialstyrelsen (The Swedish Health Board)

secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of heart failure and myocardial infarction in the study population compared with age and sex-matched Controls. Control data obtained via Socialstyrelsen (The Swedish Health Board)

study_pop.textblock: Patients with Premature Ventricular Complexes treated at Three major hospitals in the Stockholm area (Danderyd Hospital, Karolinska Hospital and Södersjukhuset Hospital)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with Premature Ventricular Complexes at Three major Hospitals in Stockholm, Sweden
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of Myocardial Infarction
- Undergone coronary arterty bypass grafting (CABG)
- Finding of Heart Failure at echocardiography
- Direct or indirect findings of coronary ischaemia at exercise test, coronary angiography or other equivalent examination
